content.title: Takayasu Arteritis Imaging
content.definition: Imaging modalities and findings used to diagnose, assess disease extent, and monitor activity in Takayasu arteritis, a large vessel vasculitis affecting the aorta and its major branches.

concepts.definition: Cross-sectional imaging appearance of Takayasu arteritis.

clinical_features.wall_thickening: Concentric arterial wall thickening in active disease
clinical_features.stenosis: Long segment smooth stenoses of aorta and branches
clinical_features.aneurysm: Less common, more in descending and abdominal aorta

clinical_features.monitoring: Useful for assessing response to immunosuppression
clinical_features.limitations: Reduced sensitivity after steroids, false positive in atherosclerosis

clinical_features.carotid: Macaroni sign - diffuse concentric wall thickening
clinical_features.halo_sign: Hypoechoic wall thickening in acute phase
clinical_features.follow_up: Useful for serial monitoring of carotid involvement

clinical_features.role: Less used for diagnosis, more for intervention planning
clinical_features.findings: Smooth long segment stenoses, occlusions, collaterals

clinical_features.initial_workup: CTA or MRA preferred for diagnosis and extent mapping

content.statement: Takayasu Arteritis Imaging is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Vasculitis that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
